title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way of expressing numbers that are too large or too small to be conveniently written in decimal form. It involves a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ multiplied by a power of $$10$$.

title: Identifying the Significant Figures
text: To convert a number to scientific notation, first identify the significant figures in the number. For the diameter of an electron: $$0.00000000000094$$, the significant figure is $$9.4$$.

title: Determining the Power of $$10$$
text: Count how many places you need to move the decimal point to the right to get a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$. This will determine the power of $$10$$.

title: Scaffold 1: Move the Decimal Point
text: Move the decimal point of $$0.00000000000094$$ to the right until you get a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$. Record the number after moving the decimal point.

title: Scaffold 2: Count the Decimal Moves
text: How many places do you move the decimal point to the right?

title: Writing the Final Answer in Scientific Notation
text: Combine the number from Scaffold $$1$$ with the power of $$10$$ from Scaffold $$2$$ in the format: (number) * $${10}^{power}$$.
